Detailed Description

Contains static method for determining if a point is inside a polygon.

Definition at line 14 of file InsideUtil.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<class POINT_ITERATOR, class P>
bool InsideUtil::inside (  const POINT_ITERATOR &  begin,
const POINT_ITERATOR &  end,
const P &  p
)  [inline, static]
 

Contains static method for determining if a point is inside a polygon.

Uses the default XYHelper of the coordinate class sent in, for custom XYHelper, see the other inside function. <br /> Example: const vector<MC2Coordinate>& vectorOfCoordinates = something(); InsideUtil::inside(vectorOfCoordinates.begin(), vectorOfCoordinates.end(), MC2Coordinate(21123,123213) );

Parameters:
begin Iterator of points containing the beginning of the polygon.
end End iterator of the polygon, i.e. one position after the last point.
p The point to check.
Returns:
True if the point was inside the polygon, false otherwise.

Definition at line 117 of file InsideUtil.h.

template<class POINT_ITERATOR, class P, class XY_HELPER>
bool InsideUtil::inside (  const POINT_ITERATOR &  begin,
const POINT_ITERATOR &  end,
const P &  p,
const XY_HELPER &  helper
)  [inline, static]
 

Contains static method for determining if a point is inside a polygon.

Use the other inside if you have an MC2Coordinate or MC2Point, since they have XYHelpers defined in their class definition.

Parameters:
begin Iterator of points containing the beginning of the polygon.
end End iterator of the polygon, i.e. one position after the last point.
p The point to check.
helper The coordinate helper class for the point. Usually P::XYHelper will work.
Returns:
True if the point was inside the polygon, false otherwise.

Definition at line 62 of file InsideUtil.h.

References isLeft().

template<class P>
int InsideUtil::isLeft (  const P &  p0,
const P &  p1,
const P &  p2
)  [inline, static]
 

Tests if a point is left/on/right of an infinite line.

Parameters:
p0 The first point of the infinite line.
p1 The second point of the infinte line.
p2 The point to check.
Returns:
>0 for P2 left of the line through P0 and P1 =0 for P2 on the line <0 for P2 right of the line.
